name: Oss Business and data analytics Meetup
description: This meet up is aimed towards discussing and developing methods used for analysing data within a Business analyst role and how this can be developed with the use of languages such as Python, MongoDB, SQL (for the data base side) and others.

next_event.name: Discuss the business and data analytics with respect to various coding languages

name: DarmstadtJS - JavaScript, AngularJS, React, Node.js  Meetup
description: Diese Gruppe ist für begeisterte JavaScript Entwickler aber auch für interessierte Leute die sich von JavaScript begeistern lassen wollen :-)

name: Lake Norman Golang Meetup
description: The Lake Norman Golang Meetup (sponsored by SkilStak Coding Arts) is free for anyone, of any age, to learn more about the Go programming language, created as a pet project by renowned computer scientist Rob Pike and his team while at Google and since adopted as a core language by top enterprises such as Docker, 10gen, Canonical, Dropbox, Parse, and others. Apple and Microsoft have even posted jobs and expressed interest. Come find out why this amazing language, that compiles to statically-linked binary code (like C) and has a strange but easy syntax like Python, that can cross-compile on one OS to any other target OS including Android and iOS, has attracted a fandom from otherwise normally distant communities like Java, Python, C/C++, Node, Perl and more.

name: STLJS
description: Hang out and discuss JavaScript tips, tricks, hacks, and frameworks with fellow scripters in the Saint Louis area. Show off cool stuff you've done and discuss developments in the greater JS community: stljs.org | node.js meatspace | youtube | github | twitter | facebook | linkedin | google+ | google groups | irc://irc.freenode.net/stljs

name: Big League JavaScript
description: This is a group for intermediate to advanced developers who use JavaScript and want to take their skills to the next level. We run seminars and hands-on workshops about building software with front-end frameworks (such as Angular, React, etc), running JavaScript server-side with Node.js, and using compile-to-JS languages like TypeScript and ClojureScript.

name: The Things Network in Dallas Metroplex
description:
This meetup is about the Internet-of-Things (IoT) wireless network called "The Things Network" (TTN). It is based on LoRaWAN technology. The key characteristics that define this network are:

• open-source 

• crowd-sourced

• low-power and long-range (think miles of range for battery-operated sensors nodes)

• low-cost

It was started in by a small group in Amsterdam, Netherlands, but it's taking the world by the storm. Now, there are over 5000 members in many cities and communities worldwide. This wireless network, comprised of small and inexpensive gateways, helps local communities and businesses solve their unique local problems or improve quality of life by applying the latest IoT technologies. 

The solid foundations, like the cloud network, have been created by early members, but we need to build the local wireless infrastructure, so we all can benefit.

This meetup is for IoT technology and business enthusiasts. Let's get creative, let's strategize, let's learn, let's build something awesome. Join us!

More about The Things Network: 

https://www.thethingsnetwork.org/

Note: This meeting was previously called "Internet of Things (IoT) Prototyping". We, the Organizers, have decided to update it in order to give it more focus on community-friendly The Things Network.

name: Markham Javascript Coders
description:
If you like to code for fun, and javascript is your language, then this is the group for you. Any skill level is welcome, whether you've never coded in your life, or if you've had decades of experience. Meetups will revolve around pair/group programming, but if you'd like to solo code, then that's fine as well. We will start off with a few programming challenges, and then work our way into projects. It is a good opportunity to network as well as get help on personal side projects. 

All type of javascript projects are welcome: Node backends like Express/Koa, frontends like React/Angular/Vue, games made in libraries like Phaser, even mobile or desktop apps made in React Native or Electron.

organizer.name: Stuart S
organizer.bio: I'm a pretty simple guy. I'm passionate about programming. I'd do it for hours a day even if I didn't have to work. I enjoy weightlifting, rock climbing and general fitness. On my lazy days I like to watch football while reading The Economist.

name: Bitcoin and Alt-Coins GDL Node
description: Punto de encuentro para conocer a fondo y compartir experiencias sobre Bitcoin y Alt-Coins

organizer.name: Alan Rosas
organizer.bio: Geek, star wars & star trek fan, IT infrastructure support (Servers Guy)

name: The Starter's Academy
description: Learn how to design, code, and deliver web applications. The Starter's Academy is creating a growing, vibrant community of people with the skills to build the web applications they envision. Our instructors tailor the workshop to your knowledge and goals. We will teach you how to imagine, build, and demo minimum viable products. using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Backbone.js, and Node.js. Learning these skills can help you start a new career, launch a product, or create a company.

name: SoCal Application Developers
description:
This is a group for anyone interested in application development. We will meet to present and discuss the latest trends in web and mobile development. Our primary focus is the stack of technologies that developers are using to build the modern Internet, including but not limited to MVC/MV* frameworks, JavaScript, Ruby, Rails, Angular JS, Ember JS, Backbone JS, Meteor JS, Knockout JS, the MEAN Stack (MongoDB, Express JS, Angular JS, Node JS),  REST, JSON, JSONP, RESTful APIs, CoffeeScript, the Yeoman workflow, Grunt, Gulp, npm, Bower, Jasmine, Karma, Mocha, NoSQL, CouchDB, HTML5, CSS, Bootstrap, LESS, SASS, PhoneGap, Ionic, Apache Cordova, and Firebase to name just a few.

We will focus on learning and best practices for integrating the every combination and permutation of technologies that make up the stack faced by developers in this fluid and dynamic ecosystem. We are technology evangelists and at the same time technology agnostic. Please use this as a place to freely share your knowledge and experiences as well as discuss and debate your opinions. This is more than just a Meetup... it is a marketplace for ideas and information.

Please feel free to suggest topics, events, presenters, and venues... we need your input. 

Also, please feel free to use the forums to discuss technology, ask for help, and offer help. This is our community so let's make the most of it.

name: SCV Startup Community
description:
Connect the digital people (tech entrepreneurs, programmers, and designers...) and high quality venture investors to establish, mentor, and grow technology companies in Southern California. The next great tech companies will come from SCV!


Keywords: android iphone sdk webos python django finance chief executive office cap table term sheet solr lucene apache cto ceo user interface experience agile scrum xp lean product development customer development customer discovery hadoop pig hive tableau zeromq venture php ruby rails nosql cassandra riak hbase mongodb node clojure

name: FresNode.js
description: This is a group for node.js developers located in California's Central Valley.

name: Baidu Open Data Center (ODC) Meetup
description: Join us for an ODC discussion. Topics include: modularized datacenters, custom rack and node level design, environmental challenges...

name: Programming Prep for Startup Engineering - SF Bay Area
description: This is a group for SF Bay Area people who want to work on learning Javascript and related tools (node.js, backbone.js, etc.) for use in a course like the Stanford Startup Engineering course on Coursera that ran in the summer of 2013. The intended audience is non-programmers who want to learn and experienced programmers who want to teach. It is a follow on to the meetup group for the course.

name: Joyent Seattle Meetup
description: This is the Seattle area meetup for developers, operations and other technical types interested in Joyent technology. Come join us for a technical meet up to discuss the advantages of using containers in production, and how to overcome common challenges with deployments. Anyone who is interested in using, deploying, or contributing to Triton or other Joyent open-source projects are welcome. We will discuss topics such as Docker, Node.js, Mesos, KVM, Kubernetes, OS virtualization and DevOps, as well as best practices for public, private and hybrid cloud architectures.

name: Node Brigade Vancouver
description: All about NodeJS.

name: Javascript - Iceland
description: This is a group for anyone interested in Javascript. All skill levels are welcome. The reason why this group was started is because the Node.js community in Iceland has grown a lot and we feel like we could make some meet ups on the more general topic of javascript.

organizer.name: Kristján Ingi Mikaelsson
organizer.bio:
CTO of Watchbox (https://watchboxapp.com)

Founder of the https://apis.is platform

Co-Organizer of http://jsconf.is

name: Edinburgh JavaScript Developers
description: Do you JavaScript, started the journey to ECMAScript6? Angular, React, jQuery, Mocha, Chai, Node or Mongo? (or frankly anything else) - Whether you are new to JavaScript or a seasoned developer working on the full stack. This group is for Javascript lovers to get together and discuss their adventures in code with like minded folks. This new group will meet monthly, alternating between a more structured talk and informal beer and chat and will support people looking to get used to presenting and getting their skills sharp for talks, meetups and conferences.

name: Liverpool JavaScript User Group
description:
At Liverpool JavaScript User Group we meet once a month - usually in DoESLiverpool on Hanover Street - to talk about all aspects of JavaScript from front end frameworks and user interactions in the browser to back end details of server side node and development tools.

We are open to everyone, from curious minds who've are just starting out and want to learn more to professionals refining their skills and expanding their networks.

We try to give an indication of what each talk will cover so you can decide if it's for you - If one subject doesn't take your fancy, you can skip it. Come to as many or as few meetups as you'd like.

We've started a couple of lists on Twitter of group members and past speakers to make it easier for people to keep in touch outside the group: https://twitter.com/LiverpoolJSUG/lists

The group is organised by Paul Bennett-Freeman ( https://twitter.com/OddEssay - https://oddessay.com ) - Get in touch with you have any questions at all. Hope to see you soon!

name: Meetup Developer ABC
description: Grupo para troca de conversas e experiências em devenvolvimento Front e Back-end. Desenvolvedores mobile e Web, IONIC, Angular, Node-Js, etc.
